page.title: 11Halston Chapel Whittington
page.content: {Halston Chapel}is a private chapel which is over 400 years old.It holds 65-70 people.The stone font in the chapel was given by monks.In the porch there is a medieval stone coffin in the shape of a body.The chapel has one bell and candles instead of electric lights.There is a beautiful,early eighteenth century pulpit with a canopy.On the floor of the chapel is a brass plaque commemorating{John Mytton and his daughter{Rebecca Mytton.} Outside the chapel there are 12 gravestones commemorating some of the families who have owned the hall.Many years ago,a priest lived near the chapel and held regular services. At Christmas time a family carol service is held.Attendance at this is by invitation only.
